critique: The document establishes a presidential task force on the arts and humanities, aiming to increase private support, improve federal decisions by relying on non-governmental professionals, and enhance the management of federal arts and humanities programs. It emphasizes advice from the private sector and non-governmental professionals, potentially indicating a move towards less government intervention and more private sector involvement in the arts and humanities. The order also specifies that members of the task force will not be compensated, suggesting a focus on voluntary contributions and private support.
